page.title: 07 Transport in 1985.
page.content: Today's transport in Tamworth is much quicker than walking. {Cars} use petrol and small vans diesel. Ordinary cars are for families. Lorries are for taking loads and parcels to people around the country. Most cars are made of metal but Reliant use fibre glass. The {Sinclair C5} is a new vehicle to be seen on the roads. You can pedal it like a bicycle near the edge of the road. {Trains} are powered by electricity or by diesel. Trains can carry you anywhere in the world for business or for pleasure. The trains are timetabled to arrive and depart at certain times but they never seem to be on time. Trains are quick; they never get stuck in traffic jams!
